answers.answer: There are several ways to enter Romania: with temporary protection, with the right of short-stay, or as an asylum seeker.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Ukrainian nationals who can present a valid passport at the border crossing can enter Romania and stay for up to 90 days.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the page carefully.

answers.answer: Rights associated with having a short stay status include social services, the right to work, access to education, medical assistance, and information regarding accommodation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'My rights having a short stay status'.

answers.answer: During temporary accommodation, food, clothing, personal hygiene products, primary and emergency medical care, and free medical care for acute or chronic life-threatening diseases are ensured, along with the right to be included in national public health programs.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Social services'.

answers.answer: You can register your request for resources, food, products, or clothing on the Sprijin de Urgență website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Sprijin de Urgență'.

answers.answer: If you choose not to request temporary protection but wish to work, it is necessary to apply for a work permit at the General Inspectorate for Immigration.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Work'.

answers.answer: Documents required for a residence permit for work purposes include an application request, border crossing document, proof of legal ownership of living space, labor contract, a picture from the general register of employees, registered salary, medical certificate, and tax.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Work'.

answers.answer: A work permit or visa is not required if you do not have the necessary documents like diplomas or certifications; in this case, you will give a statement about your training or experience and lack of criminal record.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Work'.

answers.answer: ANOFM (National Agency for Employment) offers free services to benefit from measures of employment incentive and protection within the unemployment insurance system, provided you register with county employment agencies or the Bucharest municipality.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Work'.

answers.answer: Children and young refugees from Ukraine can enroll in the Romanian education system if they have legal residence in Romania, specifically by benefiting from temporary protection or asylum.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Education'.

answers.answer: Foreign nationals or stateless persons from the Ukraine conflict zone benefit from medical services, supplies, medicines, medical devices, and medical services included in national curative health programs, similar to insured Romanian citizens.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Medical assistance'.

answers.answer: Foreign nationals from the Ukraine conflict zone benefit from medical services without paying contributions to the social health insurance system, with exemption from co-payment, and without needing a referral for specialized outpatient healthcare.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Medical assistance'.

answers.answer: Currently, there is no financial support available for renting a home in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Individuals and legal entities hosting people from the conflict zone in Ukraine can benefit from the reimbursement of daily accommodation and food expenses.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Accommodation'.

answers.answer: Un Acoperiș provides support in finding temporary accommodation for vulnerable people who are coming to Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the section under 'Un Acoperiș'.

answers.answer: You can apply for asylum within Romania at a later point after entering the country.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/short-stay and read the page carefully.
